channel.title: Sync Libraries failure
channel.description:
I'm using Win 7 and Axoloti version 1.0.12-0-g80370d2
I haven't had problems in the past seeing new objects from the community, but none of the newest posts from the last month are available to me. When I try to sync libraries I get this:
Sync Successful : factory (1.0.12,anon) Sync (pull) FAILED : community (1.0.12,anon) org.eclipse.jgit.api.errors.CheckoutConflictException: Checkout conflict with files: objects/tiar/dist/DP inv2.axh objects/tiar/dist/DP type IIA and PM.axh objects/tiar/dist/DPHardClip.axo objects/tiar/dist/rectify.axh objects/tiar/dist/rectify.axo objects/tiar/filter/ZDF SVF 1.axo objects/tiar/lfo/triphase_vlfo.axo objects/tiar/osc/Osc_Bnk_I.axh objects/tiar/string/mux2.axo org.eclipse.jgit.api.errors.CheckoutConflictException: Checkout conflict with files: objects/tiar/dist/DP inv2.axh objects/tiar/dist/DP type IIA and PM.axh objects/tiar/dist/DPHardClip.axo objects/tiar/dist/rectify.axh objects/tiar/dist/rectify.axo objects/tiar/filter/ZDF SVF 1.axo objects/tiar/lfo/triphase_vlfo.axo objects/tiar/osc/Osc_Bnk_I.axh objects/tiar/string/mux2.axo at org.eclipse.jgit.api.MergeCommand.call(MergeCommand.java:419) at org.eclipse.jgit.api.PullCommand.call(PullCommand.java:331) at axoloti.utils.AxoGitLibrary.pull(AxoGitLibrary.java:331) at axoloti.utils.AxoGitLibrary.sync(AxoGitLibrary.java:70) at axoloti.menus.FileMenu.jMenuSyncActionPerformed(FileMenu.java:264) at axoloti.menus.FileMenu.access$400(FileMenu.java:51) at axoloti.menus.FileMenu$5.actionPerformed(FileMenu.java:134) at javax.swing.AbstractButton.fireActionPerformed(AbstractButton.java:2022) at javax.swing.AbstractButton$Handler.actionPerformed(AbstractButton.java:2348) at item.title: Sync Libraries failure
item.dc:creator: @1_n Neil
item.description:
@1_n wrote:

This makes sense - thank you!

item.title: Sync Libraries failure
item.dc:creator: @lokki
item.description:
@lokki wrote:

that means you don't have a startup patch on your sdcard...you can ignore that file error warning.

Read full topic

item.title: Sync Libraries failure
item.dc:creator: @1_n Neil
item.description:
@1_n wrote:

Okay, it took 15 minutes to reset libraries - and the folders are replaced in the main 'Axoloti' folder, and folder contents are now showing after restart.

Still getting file error message:

connected
Authentic Axoloti Core
search path : /Users/n/Documents/axoloti/axoloti-factory/objects
file error: FR_NO_FILE, filename:"/START.BIN"
Firmware version: 1.0.0.1, crc=0xE95BAC96, entrypoint=0x20011000
search path : /Users/n/Documents/axoloti/objects
search path : /Users/n/Documents/axoloti/axoloti-contrib/objects
finished loading objects

Does this mean I have to do a make-over and start the process again?

Regards,

1

Read full topic

item.title: Sync Libraries failure
item.dc:creator: @1_n Neil
item.description:
@1_n wrote:

Hello - sorry to add to this thread, but it's the same issue and I'm hoping for assistance to get myself working again.

I've come back to Axoloti after building the Music Thing Modular controller. Community and Contrib folders had content, but were not syncing and had disappeared from the patch-builder since I last used Axoloti.

No changes to my iMac since I last used the board - that I can recall - and folders in the same place.

I deleted Contrib, Community and Factory folders, restarted and got this:

USB device found
connected
Authentic Axoloti Core
file error: FR_NO_FILE, filename:"/START.BIN"
Firmware version: 1.0.0.1, crc=0xE95BAC96, entrypoint=0x20011000

Apologies for basic errors...

regards,

1_n

Read full topic

item.title: Sync Libraries failure
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

blaerg:

Well, you left me hanging after it broke, despite my request for further assistance.

I'm an unpaid volunteer here... i come here when i have time, and i post when i have something to say... and as I said, i was a bit stumped... this process has worked for everyone else in the past.
(as you can see, my suggestion about anti virus, is pretty much a guess, ive no idea if you have an anti virus installed, and if so which one... nor which ones are failing - as we have never seen this for the libraries before - as i said, a guess only)

blaerg:

It exceeded the character limit for posting!

then put it in a text file, and upload it to somewhere like dropbox and post a link... as i said, full logs are important, what a user thinks is 'not important'/relevant may not always be the case.

blaerg:

Despite the same settings as always, this was somehow preventing the download. I disabled it and the sync worked immediately.

cool, glads its working for you now.

Read full topic

item.title: Sync Libraries failure
item.dc:creator: @blaerg
item.description:
@blaerg wrote:

thetechnobear:

i said delete the entire directory... both factory and community

I had done that.

thetechnobear:

do not just delete the directory contents, which is what you have done, hence the 'removed' messages.

No that is not correct.

thetechnobear:

when you do the reset all, are you getting any errors, if so post the entire console, i need to know exactly what is going on.

It exceeded the character limit for posting!

thetechnobear:

i can only think its something to do with either your network connection, or perhaps something on your system (anti virus) interfering.

Despite the same settings as always, this was somehow preventing the download. I disabled it and the sync worked immediately.

thetechnobear:

so its not about being boring or not...

Well, you left me hanging after it broke, despite my request for further assistance.

Read full topic

item.title: Sync Libraries failure
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

i said delete the entire directory... both factory and community

do not just delete the directory contents, which is what you have done, hence the 'removed' messages.

i also have no idea why the 'reset all' does not work for you,
we have done this with lots of people, and its always worked - it was the 'full back solution' , i tested recently it works for me on both windows and mac.

i can only think its something to do with either your network connection, or perhaps something on your system (anti virus) interfering.

when you do the reset all, are you getting any errors, if so post the entire console, i need to know exactly what is going on.

so its not about being boring or not... its just from what you've told me so far, I'm not really sure why your system is different from everyone else.

Read full topic

item.title: Sync Libraries failure
item.dc:creator: @blaerg
item.description:
@blaerg wrote:

I know this is a terribly un-sexy and boring problem but I am in dire need of assistance or at least some level of understanding. The end-user, non-coder, non-DIY person begs you. Please.

When I tried to sync libraries, no new modules arrived. I then deleted them as suggested. Now many of them are "removed." I don't understand what is happening or how to repair this.

item.title: Sync Libraries failure
item.dc:creator: @blaerg
item.description:
@blaerg wrote:

Some but not all of my objects won't reload. Please help me to understand and correct.

When I look at the actual directories, I can see that there are new objects included, yet these are not options when I try to add them in the patcher...

Read full topic

item.title: Sync Libraries failure
item.dc:creator: @blaerg
item.description:
@blaerg wrote:

thetechnobear:

you said yes, to delete all directories?

Yes. I puckered up because it seemed like a bad option.

I removed the two folders (contrib and factory) from the Axoloti directory, restarted Axoloti but it didn't download the folders.

Tried your reset procedure again, and now only some of the objects have returned. Should just manually download the folders from github and place them in the directory?

Read full topic

item.title: Sync Libraries failure
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

you said yes, to delete all directories?

Ive done the same here, and its working fine...
usually this is caused by network issues, or not being able to write files to the directories?!
but cant think why you are getting it.

you could try closing down axoloti,
deleting the library which are in:
C:\Users\System User\Documents\axoloti
axoloti-contrib, axoloti-factory
and then restarting...

no particular reason it should work, but its very unusual for reset all not work, as it basically just deletes the directories and then redownloads them from GitHub

Read full topic

item.title: Sync Libraries failure
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

theres some problem with files listed being changed 'inconsistently' , hard to say exactly what

anyway solution is simple, reset the libraries
file->preferences->reset all

Read full topic

item.title: Sync Libraries failure
item.dc:creator: @blaerg
item.description:
@blaerg wrote:

I'm using Win 7 and Axoloti version 1.0.12-0-g80370d2

I haven't had problems in the past seeing new objects from the community, but none of the newest posts from the last month are available to me. When I try to sync libraries I get this:
